channel.title: Client Error On Every Single Client I Try
channel.description:
every single client i try always has this error...
[code]Exception in thread "main" java.lang.NoClassDefFoundError: Gui Caused by: java.lang.ClassNotFoundException: Gui at java.net.URLClassLoader$1.run(Unknown Source) at java.security.AccessController.doPrivileged(Native Method) at java.net.URLClassLoader.findClass(Unknown Source) at java.lang.ClassLoader.loadClass(Unknown Source) at sun.misc.Launcher$AppClassLoader.loadClass(Unknown Source) at java.lang.ClassLoader.loadClass(Unknown Source) Could not find the main class: Gui. Program will exit. Press any key to continue . . . [/code]
how to fix?

item.title: Client Error On Every Single Client I Try
item.dc:creator: @recker450 recker450
item.description:
@recker450 wrote:

perhaps it your java?(the jdk ones)

Read full topic
item.source: Client Error On Every Single Client I Try

item.title: Client Error On Every Single Client I Try
item.dc:creator: @desion desion
item.description:
@desion wrote:

Open up GUI.java with notepad and see if it has something along the lines of:

public class Gui extends client implements ActionListener, FocusListener {

If not add that line under all of the imports at the top and see if it helps.

Read full topic
item.source: Client Error On Every Single Client I Try

item.title: Client Error On Every Single Client I Try
item.dc:creator: @lol_k lol k
item.description:
@lol_k wrote:

im not retarded, i see gui.java, ive compiled yet still same error when i run the client

thanks for help anyway

Read full topic
item.source: Client Error On Every Single Client I Try

item.title: Client Error On Every Single Client I Try
item.dc:creator: @desion desion
item.description:
@desion wrote:

it can’t find GUI.class so you need to compile your client and see if that helps if not its because GUI.java is not in the client directory. If all else fails just re-download the client and compile it. And make a backup of your client in case you ever mess it up somehow. Hopefully this helped you.

Information: When you compile, your java files turn into class files that are able to be read by java.

Read full topic
